tool.name: ExportROIPACdem

param.name: in_raster
param.dialogReference: This input raster must be in geographic coordinates (not UTM or Web Mercator).

param.name: output_name
param.dialogReference:
No special characters are allowed in this filename except underscore!

The output files are named <output_name>.dem and <output_name>.dem.rsc

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference:
Output to this folder will include:

  • <output_name>.dem - 16-bit unsigned bil raster

  • <output_name>.dem.rsc - header file used by roi_pac to read image

  • <output_name>_tif.tif - TIF file (same contents as the binary raster, for troubleshooting)

param.name: unix_path
param.dialogReference: This is the unix path used on the destination machine. This path is written to the .rsc file and can be edited later.

param.name: agg_factor
param.dialogReference:
Generalizes the output DEM by the specified factor. For example, if the value 2 is specified for a 1/3 arc-second (about 30 m) input DEM, the output will be a 2/3 arc-second raster (about 60 m).

If set to 1 (default), no generalzation is done.

tool.summary: This tool converts an ArcGIS raster to an unsigned integer DEM image file for use with ROIPAC. A TIFF file is also created to verify the image output for troubleshooting purposes.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool converts an ArcGIS raster to an unsigned integer DEM image file for use with ROIPAC. A TIFF file is also created to verify the image output for troubleshooting purposes.
